Key Match Events: José Alvarado recorded three outs on seven pitches in the Phillies' 3-2 win over the Tampa Bay Rays.
Alvarado has five scoreless outings this month since returning to the roster.
His seven pitches were the second-fewest he's ever needed to pitch a full inning.
Alvarado induced a first-pitch foul out and struck out Dylan Carlson on three heaters.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Rob Thomson expressed confidence in Alvarado's ability to perform in October.
The Phillies are close to their first division title in 13 years with a magic number of nine.
Alvarado has a refreshed outlook on life and his performance has improved.
Post-Match Reflections: Alvarado's relaxed and focused mindset has contributed to his recent success.
The Phillies expect to use Alvarado in the sixth and seventh innings in October.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Carlos Estévez, Jeff Hoffman, Matt Strahm, and Orion Kerkering are other key bullpen members.
Alvarado's confidence and effectiveness have been noted by teammates and the coaching staff.
